meanings.definition: A rough version of a film before the final editing process.
meanings.sent1: The director reviewed the workprint to see what changes needed to be made.
meanings.sent2: The workprint was full of scenes that were not yet finalized.
meanings.sent3: The workprint accidentally included bloopers that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The workprint was like a puzzle waiting to be completed.
meanings.sent5: The workprint revealed the raw essence of the film.

meanings.definition: To create a rough version of a film for editing purposes.
meanings.sent1: The editor will workprint the footage before the final cut.
meanings.sent2: She workprints the scenes to get a sense of the overall flow.
meanings.sent3: He workprints quickly to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent4: Workprinting the film is like laying the foundation for the final product.
meanings.sent5: They workprint diligently to ensure a smooth editing process.
